member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext
member.summary: Provides methods to instantiate, use and destroy an audio context for playback. Static methods are provided to list available devices known by the driver.

Runs before the actual class constructor, to load available devices.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the audio context using the specified device and device parameters.
member.param: The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices.
Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Indicates whether the EFX extension should be initialized, if present.
member.exception: Occurs when the device string is invalid.
Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.

remarks.para: For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.

The number of auxilliary EFX sends depends on the audio hardware and drivers. Most Realtek devices, as well as the Creative SB Live!, support 1 auxilliary send. Creative's Audigy and X-Fi series support 4 sends. Values higher than supported will be clamped by the driver.

Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default.
Indicates whether the EFX extension should be initialized, if present.
Requires EFX enabled. The number of desired Auxiliary Sends per source.

remarks.para: For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.

members.member:
\internal Creates the audio context using the specified device. The device descriptor obtained through AudioContext.AvailableDevices, or null for the default device. Frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default. Refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Pass 0 for driver default. Flag, indicating a synchronous context. Indicates whether the EFX extension should be initialized, if present. Requires EFX enabled. The number of desired Auxiliary Sends per source. Occurs when a specified parameter is invalid.
Occurs when the specified device is not available, or is in use by another program.
Occurs when an audio context could not be created with the specified parameters.
Occurs when an AudioContext already exists.
For maximum compatibility, you are strongly recommended to use the default constructor.
Multiple AudioContexts are not supported at this point.
The number of auxilliary EFX sends depends on the audio hardware and drivers. Most Realtek devices, as well as the Creative SB Live!, support 1 auxilliary send. Creative's Audigy and X-Fi series support 4 sends. Values higher than supported will be clamped by the driver.

\internal Makes the specified AudioContext current in the calling thread. The OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext to make current, or null.
Occurs if this function is called after the AudioContext has been disposed.
Occurs when the AudioContext could not be made current.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext.CheckErrors
member.summary: Checks for ALC error conditions.
member.exception: Raised when an out of memory error is detected.
Raised when an invalid value is detected.
Raised when an invalid device is detected.
Raised when an invalid context is detected.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext.MakeCurrent
member.summary: Makes the AudioContext current in the calling thread.
member.exception: Occurs if this function is called after the AudioContext has been disposed.
Occurs when the AudioContext could not be made current.
member.remarks: Only one AudioContext can be current in the application at any time, regardless of the number of threads.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext.Process
member.summary: Processes queued audio events.

remarks.para: If AudioContext.IsSynchronized is true, this function will resume the internal audio processing thread. If AudioContext.IsSynchronized is false, you will need to call this function multiple times per second to process audio events.
In some implementations this function may have no effect.

member.exception: Occurs when this function is called after the AudioContext had been disposed.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioContext.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends processing of audio events.

remarks.para: To avoid audio artifacts when calling this function, set audio gain to zero before suspending an AudioContext.
In some implementations, it can be faster to suspend processing before changing AudioContext state.
In some implementations this function may have no effect.

member.exception: Occurs when this function is called after the AudioContext had been disposed.

member.returns: true if the extension is supported; false otherwise.

member.summary: Makes the GraphicsContext current in the calling thread.
member.param: An OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo structure that points to a valid window.

remarks.para: OpenGL commands in one thread, affect the GraphicsContext which is current in that thread.
It is an error to issue an OpenGL command in a thread without a current GraphicsContext.

member.summary: Retrieves an unmanaged function pointer to the specified function.
member.param: A that defines the name of the function.
member.returns: A that contains the address of funcname or IntPtr.Zero, if the function is not supported by the drivers.

member.name: P:OpenTK.BindingsBase.RebuildExtensionList

member.name: P:OpenTK.BindingsBase.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the bindings implementation.
member.remarks: This object should be unique across bindings but consistent between bindings of the same type. For example, ES10.GL, OpenGL.GL and CL10.CL should all return unique objects, but all instances of ES10.GL should return the same object.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EffectsExtension.GenEffects(System.Int32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The GenEffects function is used to create one or more Effect objects. An Effect object stores an effect type and a set of parameter values to control that Effect. In order to use an Effect it must be attached to an Auxiliary Effect Slot object
member.remarks: After creation an Effect has no type (EfxEffectType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of effect should be stored in the object, using Effect() with EfxEffecti.
member.param: Number of Effects to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect object identifiers.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EffectsExtension.GenEffects(System.Int32,System.Int32@)

member.remarks: After creation an Effect has no type (EfxEffectType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of effect should be stored in the object, using Effect() with EfxEffecti.
member.param: Number of Effects to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect object identifiers.

member.summary: Generates one or more effect objects.

remarks.para: The GenEffects function is used to create one or more Effect objects. An Effect object stores an effect type and a set of parameter values to control that Effect. In order to use an Effect it must be attached to an Auxiliary Effect Slot object.

After creation an Effect has no type (EfxEffectType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of effect should be stored in the object, using Effect() with EfxEffecti.

member.summary: Generates a single effect object.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EffectsExtension.GenFilters(System.Int32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The GenFilters function is used to create one or more Filter objects. A Filter object stores a filter type and a set of parameter values to control that Filter. Filter objects can be attached to Sources as Direct Filters or Auxiliary Send Filters.
member.remarks: After creation a Filter has no type (EfxFilterType.Null), so before it can be used to store a set of parameters, the application must specify what type of filter should be stored in the object, using Filter() with EfxFilteri.
member.param: Number of Filters to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Filter object identifiers.

member.param: Number of Filters to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Filter object identifiers.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EffectsExtension.GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots(System.Int32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots function is used to create one or more Auxiliary Effect Slots. The number of slots that can be created will be dependant upon the Open AL device used.
member.remarks: An application should check the OpenAL error state after making this call to determine if the Effect Slot was successfully created. If the function call fails then none of the requested Effect Slots are created. A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. If an error is set then the loop can be broken and the application can determine if sufficient resources are available.
member.param: Number of Auxiliary Effect Slots to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect Slot object identifiers.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EffectsExtension.GenAuxiliaryEffectSlots(System.Int32,System.Int32@)

member.remarks: An application should check the OpenAL error state after making this call to determine if the Effect Slot was successfully created. If the function call fails then none of the requested Effect Slots are created. A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. If an error is set then the loop can be broken and the application can determine if sufficient resources are available.
member.param: Number of Auxiliary Effect Slots to be created.
Pointer addressing sufficient memory to store n Effect Slot object identifiers.

A good strategy for creating any OpenAL object is to use a for-loop and generate one object each loop iteration and then check for an error condition. member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.GetError
member.summary: Error support. Obtain the most recent error generated in the AL state machine. When an error is detected by AL, a flag is set and the error code is recorded. Further errors, if they occur, do not affect this recorded code. When alGetError is called, the code is returned and the flag is cleared, so that a further error will again record its code.
member.returns: The first error that occured. can be used with AL.GetString. Returns an Alenum representing the error state. When an OpenAL error occurs, the error state is set and will not be changed until the error state is retrieved using alGetError. Whenever alGetError is called, the error state is cleared and the last state (the current state when the call was made) is returned. To isolate error detection to a specific portion of code, alGetError should be called before the isolated section to clear the current error state.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.IsExtensionPresent(System.String)

member.param: A string naming the desired extension. Example: "EAX-RAM"
member.returns: Returns True if the Extension is available or False if not available.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.GetProcAddress(System.String)
member.summary: This function returns the address of an OpenAL extension function. Handle with care.
member.param: A string containing the function name.
member.returns: The return value is a pointer to the specified function. The return value will be IntPtr.Zero if the function is not found.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.GetEnumValue(System.String)
member.summary: This function returns the enumeration value of an OpenAL token, described by a string.
member.param: A string describing an OpenAL token. Example "AL_DISTANCE_MODEL"
member.returns: Returns the actual ALenum described by a string. Returns 0 if the string doesn’t describe a valid OpenAL token.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourcePlay(System.Int32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: This function plays a set of sources. The playing sources will have their state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.
member.param: The number of sources to be played.
A pointer to an array of sources to be played.

A pointer to an array of sources to be played.

member.summary: This function plays, replays or resumes a source. The playing source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.
member.param: The name of the source to be played.

member.param: The name of the source to be played.

member.summary: This function stops a source. The stopped source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Stopped.
member.param: The name of the source to be stopped.

member.summary: This function stops a source. The stopped source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Stopped.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.
member.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The number of buffers to be queued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names to be queued.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.
member.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The number of buffers to be queued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names to be queued.

All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: This function unqueues a set of buffers attached to a source. The number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed, which is the maximum number of buffers that can be unqueued using this call. The unqueue operation will only take place if all n buffers can be removed from the queue.
member.param: The name of the source to unqueue buffers from.
The number of buffers to be unqueued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names that were removed.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.UInt32[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.GenBuffers(System.Int32,System.UInt32*)
member.summary: This function generates one or more buffers, which contain audio buffer (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
member.param: The number of buffers to be generated.
Pointer to an array of uint values which will store the names of the new buffers.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.DopplerFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.DopplerFactor is a simple scaling of source and listener velocities to exaggerate or deemphasize the Doppler (pitch) shift resulting from the calculation.
member.param: A negative value will result in an error, the command is then ignored. The default value is 1f. The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.DopplerVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: This function is deprecated and should not be used.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AL.SpeedOfSound(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.SpeedOfSound allows the application to change the reference (propagation) speed used in the Doppler calculation. The source and listener velocities should be expressed in the same units as the speed of sound.
member.param: A negative or zero value will result in an error, and the command is ignored. Default: 343.3f (appropriate for velocity units of meters and air as the propagation medium). The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

The default distance model in OpenAL is ALDistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL
member.summary: OpenGL bindings for .NET, implementing the full OpenGL API, including extensions.

remarks.para: This class contains all OpenGL enums and functions defined in the latest OpenGL specification. The official .spec files can be found at: http://opengl.org/registry/.
A valid OpenGL context must be created before calling any OpenGL function.

Use the GL.Load and GL.LoadAll methods to prepare function entry points prior to use. To maintain cross-platform compatibility, this must be done for both core and extension functions. The GameWindow and the GLControl class will take care of this automatically.

You can use the GL.SupportsExtension method to check whether any given category of extension functions exists in the current OpenGL context. Keep in mind that different OpenGL contexts may support different extensions, and under different entry points. Always check if all required extensions are still supported when changing visuals or pixel formats.
You may retrieve the entry point for an OpenGL function using the GL.GetDelegate method.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsBindingsBase

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsBindingsBase.GetAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an unmanaged function pointer to the specified function.
member.param: A that defines the name of the function.
member.returns: A that contains the address of funcname or IntPtr.Zero, if the function is not supported by the drivers.
member.remarks: Note: some drivers are known to return non-zero values for unsupported functions. Typical values include 1 and 2 - inheritors are advised to check for and ignore these values.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Accum(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.AccumOp,System.Single)
member.summary: Operate on the accumulation buffer

param.name: op
param.para: Specifies the accumulation buffer operation. Symbolic constants GL_ACCUM, GL_LOAD, GL_ADD, GL_MULT, and GL_RETURN are accepted.

param.name: value
param.para: Specifies a floating-point value used in the accumulation buffer operation. op determines how value is used.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ActiveTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit)
member.summary: Select active texture unit

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the larger of (GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1) and (GL_MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS - 1). The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.AlphaFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.AlphaFunction,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify the alpha test function

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the alpha comparison function. Symbolic constants GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_EQUAL, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_NOTEQUAL, GL_GEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS are accepted. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value that incoming alpha values are compared to. This value is clamped to the range [0,1], where 0 represents the lowest possible alpha value and 1 the highest possible value. The initial reference value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Bitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Draw a bitmap

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the pixel width and height of the bitmap image.

param.name: xorig
param.para: Specify the location of the origin in the bitmap image. The origin is measured from the lower left corner of the bitmap, with right and up being the positive axes.

param.name: xmove
param.para: Specify the x and y offsets to be added to the current raster position after the bitmap is drawn.

param.name: bitmap
param.para: Specifies the address of the bitmap image.

param.name: modeAlpha
param.para: specifies the alpha blend equation, how the alpha component of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.BlendFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BlendingFactorSrc,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BlendingFactorDest)
member.summary: Specify pixel arithmetic

param.name: sfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha source blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.BlendFunc(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ArbDrawBuffersBlend,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ArbDrawBuffersBlend)

param.name: dstAlpha

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.BufferData(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferUsageHint)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the buffer object's new data store.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to data that will be copied into the data store for initialization, or NULL if no data is to be copied.

param.name: usage
param.para: Specifies the expected usage pattern of the data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_STREAM_DRAW, GL_STREAM_READ, GL_STREAM_COPY, GL_STATIC_DRAW, GL_STATIC_READ, GL_STATIC_COPY, GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW, GL_DYNAMIC_READ, or GL_DYNAMIC_COPY.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.BufferSubData(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Updates a subset of a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: offset
param.para: Specifies the offset into the buffer object's data store where data replacement will begin, measured in bytes.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the data store region being replaced.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the new data that will be copied into the data store.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CallLists(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ListNameType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Execute a list of display lists

param.name: n
param.para: Specifies the number of display lists to be executed.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the type of values in lists. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_2_BYTES, GL_3_BYTES, and GL_4_BYTES are accepted.

param.name: lists
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of name offsets in the display list. The pointer type is void because the offsets can be bytes, shorts, ints, or floats, depending on the value of type.

param.para: Specifies the type of values in lists. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_2_BYTES, GL_3_BYTES, and GL_4_BYTES are accepted.

param.name: lists
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of name offsets in the display list. The pointer type is void because the offsets can be bytes, shorts, ints, or floats, depending on the value of type.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CallLists``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ListNameType,``0@)
member.summary: Execute a list of display lists

param.name: n
param.para: Specifies the number of display lists to be executed.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the type of values in lists. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_2_BYTES, GL_3_BYTES, and GL_4_BYTES are accepted.

param.name: lists
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of name offsets in the display list. The pointer type is void because the offsets can be bytes, shorts, ints, or floats, depending on the value of type.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Clear(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClearBufferMask)
member.summary: Clear buffers to preset values

param.name: mask
param.para: Bitwise OR of masks that indicate the buffers to be cleared. The four masks are GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT, GL_ACCUM_BUFFER_BIT, and GL_STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClearAccum(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify clear values for the accumulation buffer

param.name: red
param.para: Specify the red, green, blue, and alpha values used when the accumulation buffer is cleared. The initial values are all 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClearColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify clear values for the color buffers

param.name: red
param.para: Specify the red, green, blue, and alpha values used when the color buffers are cleared. The initial values are all 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClearDepth(System.Double)
member.summary: Specify the clear value for the depth buffer

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth value used when the depth buffer is cleared. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClearIndex(System.Single)
member.summary: Specify the clear value for the color index buffers

param.name: c
param.para: Specifies the index used when the color index buffers are cleared. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClearStencil(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the clear value for the stencil buffer

param.name: s
param.para: Specifies the index used when the stencil buffer is cleared. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClientActiveTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit)
member.summary: Select active texture unit

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value. The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double[])
member.summary: Specify a plane against which all geometry is clipped

param.name: plane
param.para: Specifies which clipping plane is being positioned. Symbolic names of the form GL_CLIP_PLANEi, where i is an integer between 0 and GL_MAX_CLIP_PLANES - 1, are accepted.

param.name: equation
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of four double-precision floating-point values. These values are interpreted as a plane equation.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double@)
member.summary: Specify a plane against which all geometry is clipped

param.name: plane

param.name: equation
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of four double-precision floating-point values. These values are interpreted as a plane equation.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double*)

param.name: plane
param.para: Specifies which clipping plane is being positioned. Symbolic names of the form GL_CLIP_PLANEi, where i is an integer between 0 and GL_MAX_CLIP_PLANES - 1, are accepted.

param.name: equation
param.para: Specifies the address of an array of four double-precision floating-point values. These values are interpreted as a plane equation.

member.summary: Enable and disable writing of frame buffer color components

param.name: red
param.para: Specify whether red, green, blue, and alpha can or cannot be written into the frame buffer. The initial values are all GL_TRUE, indicating that the color components can be written.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ColorMask(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

param.name: red
param.para: Specify whether red, green, blue, and alpha can or cannot be written into the frame buffer. The initial values are all GL_TRUE, indicating that the color components can be written.

param.name: red
param.para: Specify whether red, green, blue, and alpha can or cannot be written into the frame buffer. The initial values are all GL_TRUE, indicating that the color components can be written.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ColorMaterial(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MaterialFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorMaterialParameter)
member.summary: Cause a material color to track the current color

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front, back, or both front and back material parameters should track the current color. Accepted values are GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK. The initial value is GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies which of several material parameters track the current color. Accepted values are GL_EMISSION, GL_AMBIENT, GL_DIFFUSE, GL_SPECULAR, and GL_AMBIENT_AND_DIFFUSE. The initial value is GL_AMBIENT_AND_DIFFUSE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ColorPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of colors

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3 or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ColorSubTable(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Respecify a portion of a color table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: start
param.para: The starting index of the portion of the color table to be replaced.

param.name: count
param.para: The number of table entries to replace.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to replace the specified region of the color table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ColorSubTable``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

param.name: width

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CompressedTexImage1D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CompressedTexImage1D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[])

param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels deep.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ConvolutionFilter1D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ConvolutionTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define a one-dimensional convolution filter

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_CONVOLUTION_1D.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the convolution filter kernel. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The width of the pixel array referenced by data.

param.name: format

member.summary: Copy pixels into a color table

param.para: The color table target. Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal storage format of the texture image. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: x
param.para: The x coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

param.name: y
param.para: The y coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

param.name: width
param.para: The width of the pixel rectangle.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CopyTexImage1D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy pixels into a 1D texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the internal format of the texture. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_RGB, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the left corner of the row of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . The height of the texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.CopyTexImage2D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DepthFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DepthFunction)
member.summary: Specify the value used for depth buffer comparisons

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the depth comparison function. Symbolic constants GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_EQUAL, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_NOTEQUAL, GL_GEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS are accepted. The initial value is GL_LESS.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DepthMask(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable writing into the depth buffer

param.name: flag
param.para: Specifies whether the depth buffer is enabled for writing. If flag is GL_FALSE, depth buffer writing is disabled. Otherwise, it is enabled. Initially, depth buffer writing is enabled.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DepthRange(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Specify mapping of depth values from normalized device coordinates to window coordinates

param.name: nearVal
param.para: Specifies the mapping of the near clipping plane to window coordinates. The initial value is 0.

param.name: farVal
param.para: Specifies the mapping of the far clipping plane to window coordinates. The initial value is 1.

member.summary: Render primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: first
param.para: Specifies the starting index in the enabled arrays.

param.name: count
param.para: Specifies the number of indices to be rendered.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DrawBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DrawBufferMode)
member.summary: Specify which color buffers are to be drawn into

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies up to four color buffers to be drawn into. Symbolic constants GL_NONE, GL_FRONT_LEFT, GL_FRONT_RIGHT, GL_BACK_LEFT, GL_BACK_RIGHT, GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, GL_LEFT, GL_RIGHT, GL_FRONT_AND_BACK, and GL_AUXi, where i is between 0 and the value of GL_AUX_BUFFERS minus 1, are accepted. (GL_AUX_BUFFERS is not the upper limit; use glGet to query the number of available aux buffers.) The initial value is GL_FRONT for single-buffered contexts, and GL_BACK for double-buffered contexts.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DrawBuffers(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DrawBuffersEnum[])
member.summary: Specifies a list of color buffers to be drawn into

param.name: n
param.para: Specifies the number of buffers in bufs.

param.name: bufs
param.para: Points to an array of symbolic constants specifying the buffers into which fragment colors or data values will be written.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.DrawPixels(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Write a block of pixels to the frame buffer

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle to be written into the frame buffer.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. Symbolic constants GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA are accepted.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type for data. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetActiveAttrib(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ActiveAttribType@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns information about an active attribute variable for the specified program object

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the attribute variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the attribute variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the attribute variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the attribute variable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetBufferParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferParameterName,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Return parameters of a buffer object

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: value
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a buffer object parameter. Accepted values are GL_BUFFER_ACCESS, GL_BUFFER_MAPPED, GL_BUFFER_SIZE, or GL_BUFFER_USAGE.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the requested parameter.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetBufferSubData(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns a subset of a buffer object's data store

param.name: offset
param.para: Specifies the offset into the buffer object's data store from which data will be returned, measured in bytes.

param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the data store region being returned.

param.para: Specifies a pointer to the location where buffer object data is returned.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double[])
member.summary: Return the coefficients of the specified clipping plane

param.name: plane
param.para: Specifies a clipping plane. The number of clipping planes depends on the implementation, but at least six clipping planes are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_CLIP_PLANE where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_CLIP_PLANES - 1.

param.name: equation
param.para: Returns four double-precision values that are the coefficients of the plane equation of plane in eye coordinates. The initial value is (0, 0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double@)
member.summary: Return the coefficients of the specified clipping plane

param.name: plane
param.para: Specifies a clipping plane. The number of clipping planes depends on the implementation, but at least six clipping planes are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_CLIP_PLANE where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_CLIP_PLANES - 1.

param.name: equation
param.para: Returns four double-precision values that are the coefficients of the plane equation of plane in eye coordinates. The initial value is (0, 0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetClipPlane(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName,System.Double*)
member.summary: Return the coefficients of the specified clipping plane

param.name: equation

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetColorTable(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieve contents of a color lookup table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in table. The possible values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in table. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: table
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data containing the contents of the color table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetColorTable``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetCompressedTexImage(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Return a compressed texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies which texture is to be obtained. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, and GL_TEXTURE_3D GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z are accepted.

param.name: lod
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: img
param.para: Returns the compressed texture image.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetConvolutionFilter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ConvolutionTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get current 1D or 2D convolution filter kernel

param.name: target
param.para: The filter to be retrieved. Must be one of GL_CONVOLUTION_1D or GL_CONVOLUTION_2D.

param.name: format
param.para: Format of the output image. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Data type of components in the output image. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: image
param.para: Pointer to storage for the output image.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetHistogram(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HistogramTarget,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get histogram table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, each component counter that is actually returned is reset to zero. (Other counters are unaffected.) If GL_FALSE, none of the counters in the histogram table is modified.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of values to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of values to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned histogram table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetHistogram``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HistogramTarget,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetHistogramParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HistogramTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GetHistogramParameterPName,System.Single[])
member.summary: Get histogram parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM or GL_PROXY_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: pname
param.para: The name of the parameter to be retrieved. Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH, GL_HISTOGRAM_FORMAT, GL_HISTOGRAM_RED_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_GREEN_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_BLUE_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE_SIZE, or GL_HISTOGRAM_SINK.

param.name: params
param.para: Pointer to storage for the returned values.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetLight(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightName,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightParameter,System.Single[])
member.summary: Return light source parameter values

param.name: light
param.para: Specifies a light source. The number of possible lights depends on the implementation, but at least eight lights are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_LIGHT where ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_LIGHTS - 1.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a light source parameter for light. Accepted symbolic names are GL_AMBIENT, GL_DIFFUSE, GL_SPECULAR, GL_POSITION, GL_SPOT_DIRECTION, GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetLight(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightName,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightParameter,System.Single@)

param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.summary: Return evaluator parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a map. Accepted values are GL_MAP1_COLOR_4, GL_MAP1_INDEX, GL_MAP1_NORMAL, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_3, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_4, GL_MAP1_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP1_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP2_COLOR_4, GL_MAP2_INDEX, GL_MAP2_NORMAL, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_3, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_4, GL_MAP2_VERTEX_3, and GL_MAP2_VERTEX_4.

param.name: query
param.para: Specifies which parameter to return. Symbolic names GL_COEFF, GL_ORDER, and GL_DOMAIN are accepted.

param.name: v
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetMinmax(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get minimum and maximum pixel values

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, all entries in the minmax table that are actually returned are reset to their initial values. (Other entries are unaltered.) If GL_FALSE, the minmax table is unaltered.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the data to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: types
param.para: The type of the data to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned values.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the pixel map contents.

param.para: Returns the pointer value specified by pname.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetSeparableFilter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SeparableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get separable convolution filter kernel images

param.name: target
param.para: The separable filter to be retrieved. Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: format
param.para: Format of the output images. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Data type of components in the output images. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to storage for the row filter image.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to storage for the column filter image.

param.name: span
param.para: Pointer to storage for the span filter image (currently unused).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetSeparableFilter``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SeparableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexEnv(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvParameter,System.Single[])
member.summary: Return texture environment parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL, or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture environment parameter. Accepted values are GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_ENV_COLOR, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL, or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture environment parameter. Accepted values are GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_ENV_COLOR, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.summary: Return texture coordinate generation parameters

param.name: coord
param.para: Specifies a texture coordinate. Must be GL_S, GL_T, GL_R, or GL_Q.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the value(s) to be returned. Must be either GL_TEXTURE_GEN_MODE or the name of one of the texture generation plane equations: GL_OBJECT_PLANE or GL_EYE_PLANE.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexImage(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Return a texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies which texture is to be obtained. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z are accepted.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies a pixel format for the returned data. The supported formats are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies a pixel type for the returned data. The supported types are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: img
param.para: Returns the texture image. Should be a pointer to an array of the type specified by type.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexImage``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexLevelParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GetTextureParameter,System.Single[])
member.summary: Return texture parameter values for a specific level of detail

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the target texture, either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture parameter. GL_TEXTURE_WIDTH, GL_TEXTURE_HEIGHT, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH, GL_TEXTURE_INTERNAL_FORMAT, GL_TEXTURE_BORDER, GL_TEXTURE_RED_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_GREEN_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_BLUE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_LUMINANCE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_INTENSITY_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED, and GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED_IMAGE_SIZE are accepted.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the target texture, either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture parameter. GL_TEXTURE_WIDTH, GL_TEXTURE_HEIGHT, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH, GL_TEXTURE_INTERNAL_FORMAT, GL_TEXTURE_BORDER, GL_TEXTURE_RED_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_GREEN_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_BLUE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_LUMINANCE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_INTENSITY_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED, and GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED_IMAGE_SIZE are accepted.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexLevelParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GetTextureParameter,System.Int32*)

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture parameter. param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.GetTexParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GetTextureParameter,System.Single[])
member.summary: Return texture parameter values

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the target texture. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP are accepted.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture parameter. GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_TEXTURE_BORDER_COLOR, GL_TEXTURE_PRIORITY, GL_TEXTURE_RESIDENT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC, GL_DEPTH_TEXTURE_MODE, and GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP are accepted.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the texture parameters.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the vertex attribute parameter to be queried. Accepted values are GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED, or GL_CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Hint(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HintTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HintMode)
member.summary: Specify implementation-specific hints

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the behavior to be controlled. GL_FOG_HINT, GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT, GL_LINE_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_POINT_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_POLYGON_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSION_HINT, and GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_HINT are accepted.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the desired behavior. GL_FASTEST, GL_NICEST, and GL_DONT_CARE are accepted.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Histogram(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.HistogramTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define histogram table

param.name: target
param.para: The histogram whose parameters are to be set. Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM or GL_PROXY_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of entries in the histogram table. Must be a power of 2.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the histogram table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the histogramming process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the minmax process after histogramming.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.IndexPointer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.IndexPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of color indexes

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color index in the array. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive color indexes. If stride is 0, the color indexes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first index in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Light(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightName,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LightParameter,System.Single)
member.summary: Set light source parameters

param.name: light
param.para: Specifies a light. The number of lights depends on the implementation, but at least eight lights are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_LIGHT , where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_LIGHTS - 1.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a single-valued light source parameter for light. GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

param.para: Specifies a single-valued light source parameter for light. GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.LineStipple(System.Int32,System.Int16)
member.summary: Specify the line stipple pattern

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a multiplier for each bit in the line stipple pattern. If factor is 3, for example, each bit in the pattern is used three times before the next bit in the pattern is used. factor is clamped to the range [1, 256] and defaults to 1.

param.name: pattern
param.para: Specifies a 16-bit integer whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized. Bit zero is used first; the default pattern is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.LineStipple(System.Int32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Specify the line stipple pattern

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a multiplier for each bit in the line stipple pattern. If factor is 3, for example, each bit in the pattern is used three times before the next bit in the pattern is used. factor is clamped to the range [1, 256] and defaults to 1.

param.name: pattern
param.para: Specifies a 16-bit integer whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized. Bit zero is used first; the default pattern is all 1's.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of rasterized lines. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.LogicOp(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.LogicOp)
member.summary: Specify a logical pixel operation for color index rendering

param.name: opcode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant that selects a logical operation. The following symbols are accepted: GL_CLEAR, GL_SET, GL_COPY, GL_COPY_INVERTED, GL_NOOP, GL_INVERT, GL_AND, GL_NAND, GL_OR, GL_NOR, GL_XOR, GL_EQUIV, GL_AND_REVERSE, GL_AND_INVERTED, GL_OR_REVERSE, and GL_OR_INVERTED. The initial value is GL_COPY.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Map1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MapTarget,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Define a one-dimensional evaluator

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the kind of values that are generated by the evaluator. Symbolic constants GL_MAP1_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP1_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP1_INDEX, GL_MAP1_COLOR_4, GL_MAP1_NORMAL, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_3, and GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_4 are accepted.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord1, to u hat, the variable that is evaluated by the equations specified by this command.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of one control point and the beginning of the next one in the data structure referenced in points. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations.

param.name: order
param.para: Specifies the number of control points. Must be positive.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Map2(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MapTarget,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Define a two-dimensional evaluator

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the kind of values that are generated by the evaluator. Symbolic constants GL_MAP2_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP2_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP2_INDEX, GL_MAP2_COLOR_4, GL_MAP2_NORMAL, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_3, and GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_4 are accepted.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to u hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, u1 is 0 and u2 is 1.

param.name: ustride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { (i+1) j }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of ustride is 0.

param.name: uorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: v1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to v hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, v1 is 0 and v2 is 1.

param.name: vstride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { i (j+1) }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of vstride is 0.

param.name: vorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to u hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, u1 is 0 and u2 is 1.

param.name: ustride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { (i+1) j }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of ustride is 0.

param.name: uorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: v1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to v hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, v1 is 0 and v2 is 1.

param.name: vstride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { i (j+1) }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of vstride is 0.

param.name: vorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MapBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferAccess)
member.summary: Map a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object being mapped. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: access
param.para: Specifies the access policy, indicating whether it will be possible to read from, write to, or both read from and write to the buffer object's mapped data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_READ_ONLY, GL_WRITE_ONLY, or GL_READ_WRITE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MapGrid1(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Define a one- or two-dimensional mesh

param.name: un
param.para: Specifies the number of partitions in the grid range interval [u1, u2]. Must be positive.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify the mappings for integer grid domain values i = 0 and i = un.

param.name: vn
param.para: Specifies the number of partitions in the grid range interval [v1, v2] (glMapGrid2 only).

param.name: v1
param.para: Specify the mappings for integer grid domain values j = 0 and j = vn (glMapGrid2 only).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Material(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MaterialFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MaterialParameter,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify material parameters for the lighting model

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies which face or faces are being updated. Must be one of GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, or GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the single-valued material parameter of the face or faces that is being updated. Must be GL_SHININESS.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter GL_SHININESS will be set to.
