member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MatrixMode(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MatrixMode)
member.summary: Specify which matrix is the current matrix

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies which matrix stack is the target for subsequent matrix operations. Three values are accepted: GL_MODELVIEW, GL_PROJECTION, and GL_TEXTURE. The initial value is GL_MODELVIEW. Additionally, if the ARB_imaging extension is supported, GL_COLOR is also accepted.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Minmax(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define minmax table

param.name: target
param.para: The minmax table whose parameters are to be set. Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the minmax table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the minmax process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the final conversion process after minmax.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MultiDrawArrays(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BeginMode,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Render multiple sets of primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: first
param.para: Points to an array of starting indices in the enabled arrays.

param.name: count
param.para: Points to an array of the number of indices to be rendered.

param.name: primcount
param.para: Specifies the size of the first and count

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MultiDrawElements(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BeginMode,System.Int32[],OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DrawElementsType,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render multiple sets of primitives by specifying indices of array data elements

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: indices

param.name: primcount
param.para: Specifies the size of the count array.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MultiDrawElements``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BeginMode,System.Int32*,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DrawElementsType,``0[0:,0:],System.Int32)
member.summary: Render multiple sets of primitives by specifying indices of array data elements

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: count
param.para: Points to an array of the elements counts.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the type of the values in indices. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT.

param.name: indices
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the location where the indices are stored.

param.name: primcount
param.para: Specifies the size of the count array.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.MultiTexCoord1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the current texture coordinates

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the texture unit whose coordinates should be modified. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. Symbolic constant must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value.

param.name: s
param.para: Specify s, t, r, and q texture coordinates for target texture unit. Not all parameters are present in all forms of the command.

Symbolic constant must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value.

param.name: s
param.para: Specify s, t, r, and q texture coordinates for target texture unit. Not all parameters are present in all forms of the command.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.NormalPointer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.NormalPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of normals

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive normals. If stride is 0, the normals are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first normal in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ortho(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Multiply the current matrix with an orthographic matrix

param.name: left
param.para: Specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes.

param.name: bottom
param.para: Specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes.

param.name: nearVal
param.para: Specify the distances to the nearer and farther depth clipping planes. These values are negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PixelMap(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelMap,System.Int32,System.Single[])
member.summary: Set up pixel transfer maps

param.name: map
param.para: Specifies a symbolic map name. Must be one of the following: GL_PIXEL_MAP_I_TO_I, GL_PIXEL_MAP_S_TO_S, GL_PIXEL_MAP_I_TO_R, GL_PIXEL_MAP_I_TO_G, GL_PIXEL_MAP_I_TO_B, GL_PIXEL_MAP_I_TO_A, GL_PIXEL_MAP_R_TO_R, GL_PIXEL_MAP_G_TO_G, GL_PIXEL_MAP_B_TO_B, or GL_PIXEL_MAP_A_TO_A.

param.name: mapsize
param.para: Specifies the size of the map being defined.

param.name: values
param.para: Specifies an array of mapsize values.

param.name: values
param.para: Specifies an array of mapsize values.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PixelStore(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelStoreParameter,System.Single)
member.summary: Set pixel storage modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the parameter to be set. Six values affect the packing of pixel data into memory: GL_PACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_PACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_PACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_PACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_PACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_PACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_PACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT. Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PixelStore(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelStoreParameter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set pixel storage modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the parameter to be set. Six values affect the packing of pixel data into memory: GL_PACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_PACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_PACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_PACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_PACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_PACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_PACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT. Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PixelTransfer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelTransferParameter,System.Single)
member.summary: Set pixel transfer modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the pixel transfer parameter to be set. Must be one of the following: GL_MAP_COLOR, GL_MAP_STENCIL, GL_INDEX_SHIFT, GL_INDEX_OFFSET, GL_RED_SCALE, GL_RED_BIAS, GL_GREEN_SCALE, GL_GREEN_BIAS, GL_BLUE_SCALE, GL_BLUE_BIAS, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_DEPTH_SCALE, or GL_DEPTH_BIAS.

Additionally, if the ARB_imaging extension is supported, the following symbolic names are accepted: GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_BIAS, and GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_BIAS.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PixelTransfer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelTransferParameter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set pixel transfer modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the pixel transfer parameter to be set. Must be one of the following: GL_MAP_COLOR, GL_MAP_STENCIL, GL_INDEX_SHIFT, GL_INDEX_OFFSET, GL_RED_SCALE, GL_RED_BIAS, GL_GREEN_SCALE, GL_GREEN_BIAS, GL_BLUE_SCALE, GL_BLUE_BIAS, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_DEPTH_SCALE, or GL_DEPTH_BIAS.

Additionally, if the ARB_imaging extension is supported, the following symbolic names are accepted: GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_BIAS, and GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_BIAS.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PointSize(System.Single)
member.summary: Specify the diameter of rasterized points

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the diameter of rasterized points. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PolygonMode(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.MaterialFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PolygonMode)
member.summary: Select a polygon rasterization mode

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies the polygons that mode applies to. Must be GL_FRONT for front-facing polygons, GL_BACK for back-facing polygons, or GL_FRONT_AND_BACK for front- and back-facing polygons.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies how polygons will be rasterized. Accepted values are GL_POINT, GL_LINE, and GL_FILL. The initial value is GL_FILL for both front- and back-facing polygons.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PolygonOffset(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the scale and units used to calculate depth values

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a scale factor that is used to create a variable depth offset for each polygon. The initial value is 0.

param.name: units
param.para: Is multiplied by an implementation-specific value to create a constant depth offset. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.PolygonStipple(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Set the polygon stippling pattern

param.name: pattern
param.para: Specifies a pointer to a 32 times 32 stipple pattern that will be unpacked from memory in the same way that glDrawPixels unpacks pixels.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ReadBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ReadBufferMode)
member.summary: Select a color buffer source for pixels

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a color buffer. Accepted values are GL_FRONT_LEFT, GL_FRONT_RIGHT, GL_BACK_LEFT, GL_BACK_RIGHT, GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, GL_LEFT, GL_RIGHT, and GL_AUXi, where i is between 0 and the value of GL_AUX_BUFFERS minus 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ReadPixels(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Read a block of pixels from the frame buffer

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle. width and height of one correspond to a single pixel.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ReadPixels``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

param.para: Returns the pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.RenderMode(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.RenderingMode)
member.summary: Set rasterization mode

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies the rasterization mode. Three values are accepted: GL_RENDER, GL_SELECT, and GL_FEEDBACK. The initial value is GL_RENDER.

member.summary: Reset histogram table entries to zero

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_HISTOGRAM.

member.summary: Reset minmax table entries to initial values

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_MINMAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.SampleCoverage(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify multisample coverage parameters

param.name: value
param.para: Specify a single floating-point sample coverage value. The value is clamped to the range [0 ,1]. The initial value is 1.0.

param.name: invert
param.para: Specify a single boolean value representing if the coverage masks should be inverted. GL_TRUE and GL_FALSE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Scale(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Multiply the current matrix by a general scaling matrix

param.name: x
param.para: Specify scale factors along the x, y, and z axes, respectively.

member.summary: Multiply the current matrix by a general scaling matrix

param.para: Specify scale factors along the x, y, and z axes, respectively.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Scissor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Define the scissor box

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the lower left corner of the scissor box. Initially (0, 0).

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the width and height of the scissor box. When a GL context is first attached to a window, width and height are set to the dimensions of that window.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.SecondaryColorPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of secondary colors

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.SecondaryColorPointer``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.SeparableFilter2D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SeparableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define a separable two-dimensional convolution filter

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the convolution filter kernel. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by row. (This is the width of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: height
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by column. (This is the height of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in row and column. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_INTENSITY, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in row and column. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the row filter kernel.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the column filter kernel.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.SeparableFilter2D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SeparableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.ShadeModel(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ShadingModel)
member.summary: Select flat or smooth shading

param.para: Specifies a symbolic value representing a shading technique. Accepted values are GL_FLAT and GL_SMOOTH. The initial value is GL_SMOOTH.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilMask(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilMaskSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFace,System.Int32)
member.summary: Control the front and/or back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether the front and/or back stencil writemask is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilMaskSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFace,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Control the front and/or back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether the front and/or back stencil writemask is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilOp(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp)
member.summary: Set front and back stencil test actions

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.StencilOpSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFace,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp)
member.summary: Set front and/or back stencil test actions

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexCoordPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TexCoordPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of texture coordinates

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per array element. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each texture coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive texture coordinate sets. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first texture coordinate set in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexEnv(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvParameter,System.Single)
member.summary: Set texture environment parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture environment parameter. May be either GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single symbolic constant, one of GL_ADD, GL_ADD_SIGNED, GL_INTERPOLATE, GL_MODULATE, GL_DECAL, GL_BLEND, GL_REPLACE, GL_SUBTRACT, GL_COMBINE, GL_TEXTURE, GL_CONSTANT, GL_PRIMARY_COLOR, GL_PREVIOUS, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, a single boolean value for the point sprite texture coordinate replacement, a single floating-point value for the texture level-of-detail bias, or 1.0, 2.0, or 4.0 when specifying the GL_RGB_SCALE or GL_ALPHA_SCALE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexEnv(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureEnvParameter,System.Single[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexGen(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureCoordName,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureGenParameter,System.Double[])
member.summary: Control the generation of texture coordinates

param.name: coord
param.para: Specifies a texture coordinate. Must be one of GL_S, GL_T, GL_R, or GL_Q.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the texture-coordinate generation function. Must be GL_TEXTURE_GEN_MODE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single-valued texture generation parameter, one of GL_OBJECT_LINEAR, GL_EYE_LINEAR, GL_SPHERE_MAP, GL_NORMAL_MAP, or GL_REFLECTION_MAP.

param.para: Specifies a texture coordinate. Must be one of GL_S, GL_T, GL_R, or GL_Q.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the texture-coordinate generation function. Must be GL_TEXTURE_GEN_MODE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single-valued texture generation parameter, one of GL_OBJECT_LINEAR, GL_EYE_LINEAR, GL_SPHERE_MAP, GL_NORMAL_MAP, or GL_REFLECTION_MAP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexGen(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureCoordName,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureGenParameter,System.Single[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexImage1D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalFormat
param.para: Specifies the number of color components in the texture. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4, or one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexImage1D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.summary: Specify a three-dimensional texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_3D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the n sup th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalFormat
param.para: Specifies the number of color components in the texture. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4, or one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup m + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup k + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels deep.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

member.summary: Set texture parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture, which must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture parameter. pname can be one of the following: GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_TEXTURE_PRIORITY, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC, GL_DEPTH_TEXTURE_MODE, or GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value of pname.

member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture subimage

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the x direction within the texture array.

The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.VertexAttribPointer(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribPointerType,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of generic vertex attribute data

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be modified.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per generic vertex attribute. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: normalized
param.para: Specifies whether fixed-point data values should be normalized (GL_TRUE) or converted directly as fixed-point values (GL_FALSE) when they are accessed.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive generic vertex attributes. If stride is 0, the generic vertex attributes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first generic vertex attribute in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.VertexAttribPointer``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribPointerType,System.Boolean,System.Int32,``0[])

param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive vertices. If stride is 0, the vertices are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first vertex in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.ActiveTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit)
member.summary: Select active texture unit

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the larger of (GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1) and (GL_MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS - 1). The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

param.para: Specifies the target type of query object established between glBeginQuery and the subsequent glEndQuery. The symbolic constant must be GL_SAMPLES_PASSED.

param.para: Specifies the name of a query object.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.BufferData(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTargetArb,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferUsageArb)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the buffer object's new data store.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to data that will be copied into the data store for initialization, or NULL if no data is to be copied.

param.name: usage
param.para: Specifies the expected usage pattern of the data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_STREAM_DRAW, GL_STREAM_READ, GL_STREAM_COPY, GL_STATIC_DRAW, GL_STATIC_READ, GL_STATIC_COPY, GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW, GL_DYNAMIC_READ, or GL_DYNAMIC_COPY.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.ClientActiveTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit)
member.summary: Select active texture unit

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value. The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.CompressedTexImage1D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.CompressedTexImage1D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[])
member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.CompressedTexImage1D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[0:,0:])
member.summary: Specify a one-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.CompressedTexImage1D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[0:,0:,0:])

member.summary: Specify a two-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 2D texture images that are at least 64 texels wide and cube-mapped texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be Must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_3D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels deep.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.GetActiveAttrib(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ArbVertexShader@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns information about an active attribute variable for the specified program object

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the attribute variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the attribute variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the attribute variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the attribute variable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.GetBufferSubData(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTargetArb,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns a subset of a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: offset
param.para: Specifies the offset into the buffer object's data store from which data will be returned, measured in bytes.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the data store region being returned.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the location where buffer object data is returned.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.GetCompressedTexImage(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Return a compressed texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies which texture is to be obtained. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, and GL_TEXTURE_3D GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z are accepted.

param.name: lod
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: img
param.para: Returns the compressed texture image.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.GetCompressedTexImage``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,``0[])

param.name: lod
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: img
param.para: Returns the compressed texture image.

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: location
param.para: Specifies the location of the uniform variable to be queried.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the value of the specified uniform variable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.GetVertexAttrib(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribParameterArb,System.Double[])
member.summary: Return a generic vertex attribute parameter

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the generic vertex attribute parameter to be queried.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the vertex attribute parameter to be queried. Accepted values are GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED, or GL_CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.MapBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTargetArb,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ArbVertexBufferObject)
member.summary: Map a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object being mapped. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: access
param.para: Specifies the access policy, indicating whether it will be possible to read from, write to, or both read from and write to the buffer object's mapped data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_READ_ONLY, GL_WRITE_ONLY, or GL_READ_WRITE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.MultiTexCoord1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the current texture coordinates

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the texture unit whose coordinates should be modified. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. Symbolic constant must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value.

param.name: s
param.para: Specify s, t, r, and q texture coordinates for target texture unit. Not all parameters are present in all forms of the command.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.MultiTexCoord1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureUnit,System.Double*)
member.summary: Set the current texture coordinates

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the texture unit whose coordinates should be modified. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. Symbolic constant must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value.

param.name: s
param.para: Specify s, t, r, and q texture coordinates for target texture unit. Not all parameters are present in all forms of the command.

param.para: Points to 16 consecutive values that are used as the elements of a 4 times 4 row-major matrix.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.PointParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ArbPointParameters,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify point parameters

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a single-valued point parameter. GL_POINT_SIZE_MIN, GL_POINT_SIZE_MAX, GL_POINT_FADE_THRESHOLD_SIZE, and GL_POINT_SPRITE_COORD_ORIGIN are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname will be set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.SampleCoverage(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify multisample coverage parameters

param.name: value
param.para: Specify a single floating-point sample coverage value. The value is clamped to the range [0 ,1]. The initial value is 1.0.

param.name: invert
param.para: Specify a single boolean value representing if the coverage masks should be inverted. GL_TRUE and GL_FALSE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Arb.VertexAttribPointer(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribPointerTypeArb,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of generic vertex attribute data

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be modified.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per generic vertex attribute. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: normalized
param.para: Specifies whether fixed-point data values should be normalized (GL_TRUE) or converted directly as fixed-point values (GL_FALSE) when they are accessed.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive generic vertex attributes. If stride is 0, the generic vertex attributes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first generic vertex attribute in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ati.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ati.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ati.StencilOpSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.AtiSeparateStencil,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.StencilOp)
member.summary: Set front and/or back stencil test actions

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.AreTexturesResident(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Determine if textures are loaded in texture memory

param.name: n
param.para: Specifies the number of textures to be queried.

param.name: textures
param.para: Specifies an array containing the names of the textures to be queried.

param.name: residences
param.para: Specifies an array in which the texture residence status is returned. The residence status of a texture named by an element of textures is returned in the corresponding element of residences.

member.summary: Render a vertex using the specified vertex array element

param.name: i
param.para: Specifies an index into the enabled vertex data arrays.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BindTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bind a named texture to a texturing target

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the texture is bound. Must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies the name of a texture.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BindTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Bind a named texture to a texturing target

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the texture is bound. Must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies the name of a texture.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BlendColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the blend color

param.name: red
param.para: specify the components of GL_BLEND_COLOR

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BlendEquation(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendMinmax)
member.summary: Specify the equation used for both the RGB blend equation and the Alpha blend equation

param.name: mode
param.para: specifies how source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BlendEquationSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendEquationSeparate,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendEquationSeparate)
member.summary: Set the RGB blend equation and the alpha blend equation separately

param.name: modeRGB
param.para: specifies the RGB blend equation, how the red, green, and blue components of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

param.name: modeAlpha
param.para: specifies the alpha blend equation, how the alpha component of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.BlendFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendFuncSeparate,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendFuncSeparate,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendFuncSeparate,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtBlendFuncSeparate)
member.summary: Specify pixel arithmetic for RGB and alpha components separately

param.name: srcRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

param.name: srcAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha source blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for srcRGB. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha destination blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for dstRGB. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.ColorPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of colors

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3 or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.ColorSubTable(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Respecify a portion of a color table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: start
param.para: The starting index of the portion of the color table to be replaced.

param.name: count
param.para: The number of table entries to replace.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to replace the specified region of the color table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.ColorSubTable``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.summary: Define a color lookup table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_PROXY_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the color table. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, and GL_RGBA16.

param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

member.summary: Copy pixels into a 1D texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the internal format of the texture. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_RGB, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the left corner of the row of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . The height of the texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

member.summary: Render primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: first
param.para: Specifies the starting index in the enabled arrays.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.EdgeFlagPointer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Define an array of edge flags

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive edge flags. If stride is 0, the edge flags are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first edge flag in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.FogCoordPointer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtFogCoord,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of fog coordinates

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each fog coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive fog coordinates. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first fog coordinate in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetColorTable(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieve contents of a color lookup table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in table. The possible values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in table. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: table
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data containing the contents of the color table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetColorTable``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

param.para: The target color table. Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_PROXY_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: pname
param.para: The symbolic name of a color lookup table parameter. Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE_BIAS, GL_COLOR_TABLE_SCALE, GL_COLOR_TABLE_FORMAT, GL_COLOR_TABLE_WIDTH, GL_COLOR_TABLE_RED_SIZE, GL_COLOR_TABLE_GREEN_SIZE, GL_COLOR_TABLE_BLUE_SIZE, GL_COLOR_TABLE_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_COLOR_TABLE_LUMINANCE_SIZE, or GL_COLOR_TABLE_INTENSITY_SIZE.

param.name: params
param.para: A pointer to an array where the values of the parameter will be stored.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetConvolutionFilter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtConvolution,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get current 1D or 2D convolution filter kernel

param.name: target
param.para: The filter to be retrieved. Must be one of GL_CONVOLUTION_1D or GL_CONVOLUTION_2D.

param.name: format
param.para: Format of the output image. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Data type of components in the output image. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: image
param.para: Pointer to storage for the output image.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetConvolutionFilter``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtConvolution,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.summary: Get convolution parameters

param.name: params
param.para: Pointer to storage for the parameters to be retrieved.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetHistogram(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get histogram table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, each component counter that is actually returned is reset to zero. (Other counters are unaffected.) If GL_FALSE, none of the counters in the histogram table is modified.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of values to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of values to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned histogram table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetHistogram``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.summary: Get histogram table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, each component counter that is actually returned is reset to zero. (Other counters are unaffected.) If GL_FALSE, none of the counters in the histogram table is modified.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of values to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of values to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned histogram table.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetHistogramParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,System.Single[])
member.summary: Get histogram parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM or GL_PROXY_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: pname
param.para: The name of the parameter to be retrieved. Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH, GL_HISTOGRAM_FORMAT, GL_HISTOGRAM_RED_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_GREEN_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_BLUE_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_HISTOGRAM_LUMINANCE_SIZE, or GL_HISTOGRAM_SINK.

param.name: params
param.para: Pointer to storage for the returned values.
