member.summary: Get minimum and maximum pixel values

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, all entries in the minmax table that are actually returned are reset to their initial values. (Other entries are unaltered.) If GL_FALSE, the minmax table is unaltered.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the data to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: types
param.para: The type of the data to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned values.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetMinmax``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,System.Boolean,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.GetSeparableFilter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtConvolution,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get separable convolution filter kernel images

param.name: target
param.para: The separable filter to be retrieved. Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: format
param.para: Format of the output images. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Data type of components in the output images. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to storage for the row filter image.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to storage for the column filter image.

param.name: span
param.para: Pointer to storage for the span filter image (currently unused).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.Histogram(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtHistogram,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define histogram table

param.name: target
param.para: The histogram whose parameters are to be set. Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM or GL_PROXY_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of entries in the histogram table. Must be a power of 2.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the histogram table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the histogramming process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the minmax process after histogramming.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.IndexPointer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.IndexPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of color indexes

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color index in the array. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive color indexes. If stride is 0, the color indexes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first index in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.summary: Define minmax table

param.name: target
param.para: The minmax table whose parameters are to be set. Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the minmax table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the minmax process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the final conversion process after minmax.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.MultiDrawArrays(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BeginMode,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Render multiple sets of primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: first
param.para: Points to an array of starting indices in the enabled arrays.

param.name: count
param.para: Points to an array of the number of indices to be rendered.

param.name: primcount
param.para: Specifies the size of the first and count

member.summary: Render multiple sets of primitives by specifying indices of array data elements

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: count
param.para: Points to an array of the elements counts.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the type of the values in indices. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT.

param.name: indices
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the location where the indices are stored.

param.name: primcount
param.para: Specifies the size of the count array.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.MultiDrawElements``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BeginMode,System.Int32[],OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.DrawElementsType,``0[],System.Int32)

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.NormalPointer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.NormalPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of normals

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive normals. If stride is 0, the normals are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first normal in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.NormalPointer``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.NormalPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[])

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first normal in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.PointParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtPointParameters,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify point parameters

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a single-valued point parameter. GL_POINT_SIZE_MIN, GL_POINT_SIZE_MAX, GL_POINT_FADE_THRESHOLD_SIZE, and GL_POINT_SPRITE_COORD_ORIGIN are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname will be set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.PolygonOffset(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the scale and units used to calculate depth values

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a scale factor that is used to create a variable depth offset for each polygon. The initial value is 0.

param.name: units
param.para: Is multiplied by an implementation-specific value to create a constant depth offset. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.PrioritizeTextures(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Single[])
member.summary: Set texture residence priority

param.name: n
param.para: Specifies the number of textures to be prioritized.

param.name: textures
param.para: Specifies an array containing the names of the textures to be prioritized.

param.name: priorities
param.para: Specifies an array containing the texture priorities. A priority given in an element of priorities applies to the texture named by the corresponding element of textures.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.SecondaryColorPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of secondary colors

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.SecondaryColorPointer``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ColorPointerType,System.Int32,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.SeparableFilter2D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtConvolution,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define a separable two-dimensional convolution filter

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the convolution filter kernel. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by row. (This is the width of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: height
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by column. (This is the height of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in row and column. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_INTENSITY, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in row and column. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the row filter kernel.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the column filter kernel.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.SeparableFilter2D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ExtConvolution,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.TexCoordPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TexCoordPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of texture coordinates

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per array element. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each texture coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive texture coordinate sets. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first texture coordinate set in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.TexCoordPointer``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TexCoordPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.TexImage3D(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a three-dimensional texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_3D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the n sup th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalFormat
param.para: Specifies the number of color components in the texture. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4, or one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup m + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup k + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels deep.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.TexImage3D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,``0[])

member.summary: Specify a three-dimensional texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_3D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the n sup th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalFormat
param.para: Specifies the number of color components in the texture. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4, or one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup m + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup k + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 3D texture images that are at least 16 texels deep.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ext.VertexPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexPointerType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of vertex data

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per vertex. Must be 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive vertices. If stride is 0, the vertices are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first vertex in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Ingr.BlendFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.All)
member.summary: Specify pixel arithmetic for RGB and alpha components separately

param.name: srcRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

param.name: srcAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha source blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for srcRGB. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha destination blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for dstRGB. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Intel.ColorPointer(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexPointerType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of colors

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3 or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.para: Returns the requested object parameter.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.NV.VertexAttribPointer(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribParameterArb,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define an array of generic vertex attribute data

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be modified.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per generic vertex attribute. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: normalized
param.para: Specifies whether fixed-point data values should be normalized (GL_TRUE) or converted directly as fixed-point values (GL_FALSE) when they are accessed.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive generic vertex attributes. If stride is 0, the generic vertex attributes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first generic vertex attribute in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.NV.VertexAttribPointer``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.VertexAttribParameterArb,System.Int32,``0[])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Pgi.Hint(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PgiMiscHints,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify implementation-specific hints

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the behavior to be controlled. GL_FOG_HINT, GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT, GL_LINE_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_POINT_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_POLYGON_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSION_HINT, and GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_HINT are accepted.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the desired behavior. GL_FASTEST, GL_NICEST, and GL_DONT_CARE are accepted.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Sgi.ColorTableParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SgiColorTable,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SgiColorTable,System.Single[])
member.summary: Set color lookup table parameters

param.name: target
param.para: The target color table. Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: pname
param.para: The symbolic name of a texture color lookup table parameter. Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE_SCALE or GL_COLOR_TABLE_BIAS.

param.name: params
param.para: A pointer to an array where the values of the parameters are stored.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.Sgi.ColorTable(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SgiColorTable,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Define a color lookup table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_PROXY_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the color table. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, and GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of entries in the color lookup table specified by data.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the color table.

member.summary: Copy pixels into a color table

param.name: target
param.para: The color table target. Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal storage format of the texture image. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: x
param.para: The x coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

param.name: y
param.para: The y coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

param.name: width
param.para: The width of the pixel rectangle.

member.summary: Retrieve contents of a color lookup table

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in table. The possible values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in table. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: table
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data containing the contents of the color table.

member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext from a pre-existing context created outside of OpenTK.

The window this context is bound to. This must be a valid window obtained through Utilities.CreateWindowInfo.
member.exception: Occurs if handle is identical to a context already registered with OpenTK.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.#ctor(OpenTK.ContextHandle,OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo,OpenTK.Graphics.IGraphicsContext,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContextFlags)
member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext from a pre-existing context created outside of OpenTK.
member.param: The handle of the existing context. This must be a valid, unique handle that is not known to OpenTK.
The window this context is bound to. This must be a valid window obtained through Utilities.CreateWindowInfo.
A different context that shares resources with this instance, if any. Pass null if the context is not shared or if this is the first GraphicsContext instruct you construct.
The major version of the context (e.g. "2" for "2.1").
The minor version of the context (e.g. "1" for "2.1").

member.exception: Occurs if handle is identical to a context already registered with OpenTK.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CreateDummyContext
member.summary: Creates a dummy GraphicsContext to allow OpenTK to work with contexts created by external libraries.

remarks.para: Instances created by this method will not be functional. Instance methods will have no effect.
This method requires that a context is current on the calling thread.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CreateDummyContext(OpenTK.ContextHandle)
member.summary: Creates a dummy GraphicsContext to allow OpenTK to work with contexts created by external libraries.

remarks.para: Instances created by this method will not be functional. Instance methods will have no effect.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Assert
member.summary: Checks if a GraphicsContext exists in the calling thread and throws a GraphicsContextMissingException if it doesn't.
member.exception: Generated when no GraphicsContext is current in the calling thread.

members.member:
Creates an OpenGL context with the specified direct/indirect rendering mode and sharing state with the specified IGraphicsContext.
Set to true for direct rendering or false otherwise. The source IGraphicsContext to share state from..
Direct rendering is the default rendering mode for OpenTK, since it can provide higher performance in some circumastances.
The 'direct' parameter is a hint, and will ignored if the specified mode is not supported (e.g. setting indirect rendering on Windows platforms).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.SwapBuffers
member.summary: Swaps buffers on a context. This presents the rendered scene to the user.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.MakeCurrent(OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Makes the GraphicsContext the current rendering target.
member.remarks: You can use this method to bind the GraphicsContext to a different window than the one it was created from.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Update(OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Updates the graphics context. This must be called when the render target is resized for proper behavior on Mac OS X.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.LoadAll
member.summary: Loads all OpenGL entry points.
member.exception: Occurs when this instance is not current on the calling thread.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.OpenTK#Graphics#IGraphicsContextInternal#GetAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the address of an OpenGL extension function.
member.param: The name of the OpenGL function (e.g. "glGetString")
member.returns: A pointer to the specified function or IntPtr.Zero if the function isn't available in the current opengl context.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the GraphicsContext.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CurrentContext
member.summary: Gets the GraphicsContext that is current in the calling thread.
member.remarks: Note: this property will not function correctly when both desktop and EGL contexts are available in the same process. This scenario is very unlikely to appear in practice.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.ShareContexts
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether GraphicsContext resources are shared

remarks.para: If ShareContexts is true, new GLContexts will share resources. If this value is false, new GLContexts will not share resources.
Changing this value will not affect already created GLContexts.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.DirectRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether GraphicsContexts will perform direct rendering.

remarks.para: If DirectRendering is true, new contexts will be constructed with direct rendering capabilities, if possible. If DirectRendering is false, new contexts will be constructed with indirect rendering capabilities.
This property does not affect existing GraphicsContexts, unless they are recreated.
This property is ignored on Operating Systems without support for indirect rendering, like Windows and OS X.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.ErrorChecking
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether automatic error checking should be performed. Influences the debug version of OpenTK.dll, only.
member.remarks: Automatic error checking will clear the OpenGL error state. Set CheckErrors to false if you use the OpenGL error state in your code flow (e.g. for checking supported texture formats).

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.IsCurrent
member.summary: Gets a indicating whether this instance is current in the calling thread.

member.summary: Gets a indicating whether this instance has been disposed. It is an error to access any instance methods if this property returns true.

members.member:
\internal
Provides methods to create and control an opengl context on the X11 platform. This class supports OpenTK, and is not intended for use by OpenTK programs.

\internal
Drives GameWindow on X11. This class supports OpenTK, and is not intended for use by OpenTK programs.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Platform.Utilities.LoadExtensions(System.Type)
member.summary: Loads all extensions for the specified class. This function is intended for OpenGL, Wgl, Glx, OpenAL etc.
member.param: The class to load extensions for.

remarks.para: The Type must contain a nested class called "Delegates".
The Type must also implement a static function called LoadDelegate with the following signature: static Delegate LoadDelegate(string name, Type signature)
This function allocates memory.

remarks.para: The Type must contain a nested class called "Delegates".
The Type must also implement a static function called LoadDelegate with the following signature: static Delegate LoadDelegate(string name, Type signature)
This function allocates memory.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.AlcContextAttributes.EfxMaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv. Default: 2

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Color4.ToArgb
member.summary: Converts this color to an integer representation with 8 bits per channel.
member.remarks: This method is intended only for compatibility with System.Drawing. It compresses the color into 8 bits per channel, which means color information is lost.

member.summary: Compares the specified Color4 structures for equality.
member.param: The left-hand side of the comparison.
The right-hand side of the comparison.
member.returns: True if left is equal to right; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Color4.op_Inequality(OpenTK.Graphics.Color4,OpenTK.Graphics.Color4)
member.summary: Compares the specified Color4 structures for inequality.
member.param: The left-hand side of the comparison.
The right-hand side of the comparison.
member.returns: True if left is not equal to right; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Color4.op_Implicit(System.Drawing.Color)~OpenTK.Graphics.Color4
member.summary: Converts the specified System.Drawing.Color to a Color4 structure.
member.returns: A new Color4 structure containing the converted components.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Color4.op_Explicit(OpenTK.Graphics.Color4)~System.Drawing.Color
member.summary: Converts the specified Color4 to a System.Drawing.Color structure.
member.returns: A new System.Drawing.Color structure containing the converted components.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Color4.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares whether this Color4 structure is equal to the specified object.
member.returns: True obj is a Color4 structure with the same components as this Color4; false otherwise.

member.summary: Calculates the hash code for this Color4 structure.

member.name: T:OpenTK.BlittableValueType`1
member.summary: Checks whether the specified type parameter is a blittable value type.
member.remarks: A blittable value type is a struct that only references other value types recursively, which allows it to be passed to unmanaged code directly.

member.name: M:OpenTK.BlittableValueType`1.Check
member.summary: Checks whether the current typename T is blittable.
member.returns: True if T is blittable; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.BlittableValueType`1.Check(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks whether type is a blittable value type.
member.returns: True if T is blittable; false otherwise.

member.name: P:OpenTK.BlittableValueType`1.Stride
member.summary: Gets the size of the type in bytes or 0 for non-blittable types.
member.remarks: This property returns 0 for non-blittable types.

member.name: T:OpenTK.BlittableValueType
member.summary: Checks whether the specified type parameter is a blittable value type.
member.remarks: A blittable value type is a struct that only references other value types recursively, which allows it to be passed to unmanaged code directly.

member.name: M:OpenTK.BlittableValueType.Check``1(``0)
member.summary: Checks whether type is a blittable value type.
member.param: An instance of the type to check.
member.returns: True if T is blittable; false otherwise.

member.summary: Checks whether type is a blittable value type.
member.param: An instance of the type to check.
member.returns: True if T is blittable; false otherwise.

member.summary: Checks whether type is a blittable value type.

member.summary: Checks whether type is a blittable value type.
member.param: An instance of the type to check.
member.returns: True if T is blittable; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.BlittableValueType.StrideOf``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified value type in bytes or 0 if the type is not blittable.
member.typeparam: The value type. Must be blittable.
member.param: An instance of the value type.
member.returns: An integer, specifying the size of the type in bytes.
member.exception: Occurs when type is not blittable.

member.summary: Returns the size of a single array element in bytes or 0 if the element is not blittable.
member.param: An instance of the value type.

member.exception: Occurs when type is not blittable.

member.returns: An integer, specifying the size of the type in bytes.
member.exception: Occurs when type is not blittable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.BlittableValueType.StrideOf``1(``0[0:,0:,0:])
member.summary: Returns the size of a single array element in bytes or 0 if the element is not blittable.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL
member.summary: Provides access to OpenGL ES 2.0 methods.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ActiveTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureUnit)
member.summary: Select active texture unit

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the larger of (GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1) and (GL_MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS - 1). The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.AttachShader(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches a shader object to a program object

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to which a shader object will be attached.

param.name: shader
param.para: Specifies the shader object that is to be attached.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.AttachShader(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Attaches a shader object to a program object

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to which a shader object will be attached.

param.name: shader
param.para: Specifies the shader object that is to be attached.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindAttribLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Associates a generic vertex attribute index with a named attribute variable

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the handle of the program object in which the association is to be made.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be bound.

param.name: name
param.para: Specifies a null terminated string containing the name of the vertex shader attribute variable to which index is to be bound.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindAttribLocation(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Associates a generic vertex attribute index with a named attribute variable

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the handle of the program object in which the association is to be made.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be bound.

param.name: name
param.para: Specifies a null terminated string containing the name of the vertex shader attribute variable to which index is to be bound.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferTarget,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bind a named buffer object

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the buffer object is bound. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: buffer
param.para: Specifies the name of a buffer object.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindBuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferTarget,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Bind a named buffer object

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the buffer object is bound. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: buffer
param.para: Specifies the name of a buffer object.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bind a named texture to a texturing target

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the texture is bound. Must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies the name of a texture.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BindTexture(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Bind a named texture to a texturing target

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target to which the texture is bound. Must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies the name of a texture.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BlendColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the blend color

param.name: red
param.para: specify the components of GL_BLEND_COLOR

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BlendEquation(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendEquationMode)
member.summary: Specify the equation used for both the RGB blend equation and the Alpha blend equation

param.name: mode
param.para: specifies how source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BlendEquationSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendEquationMode,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendEquationMode)
member.summary: Set the RGB blend equation and the alpha blend equation separately

param.name: modeRGB
param.para: specifies the RGB blend equation, how the red, green, and blue components of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

param.name: modeAlpha
param.para: specifies the alpha blend equation, how the alpha component of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BlendFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorSrc,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorDest)
member.summary: Specify pixel arithmetic

param.name: sfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha source blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BlendFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorSrc,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorDest,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorSrc,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BlendingFactorDest)
member.summary: Specify pixel arithmetic for RGB and alpha components separately

param.name: srcRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstRGB
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, and blue destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

param.name: srcAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha source blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for srcRGB. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dstAlpha
param.para: Specified how the alpha destination blending factor is computed. The same symbolic constants are accepted as for dstRGB. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BufferData(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferTarget,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferUsage)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the buffer object's new data store.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to data that will be copied into the data store for initialization, or NULL if no data is to be copied.

param.name: usage
param.para: Specifies the expected usage pattern of the data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_STREAM_DRAW, GL_STREAM_READ, GL_STREAM_COPY, GL_STATIC_DRAW, GL_STATIC_READ, GL_STATIC_COPY, GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW, GL_DYNAMIC_READ, or GL_DYNAMIC_COPY.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.BufferData``1(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferTarget,System.IntPtr,``0[],OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferUsage)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a buffer object's data store

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the buffer object's new data store.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to data that will be copied into the data store for initialization, or NULL if no data is to be copied.

param.name: usage
param.para: Specifies the expected usage pattern of the data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_STREAM_DRAW, GL_STREAM_READ, GL_STREAM_COPY, GL_STATIC_DRAW, GL_STATIC_READ, GL_STATIC_COPY, GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW, GL_DYNAMIC_READ, or GL_DYNAMIC_COPY.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.Clear(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.ClearBufferMask)
member.summary: Clear buffers to preset values

param.name: mask
param.para: Bitwise OR of masks that indicate the buffers to be cleared. The four masks are GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT, GL_ACCUM_BUFFER_BIT, and GL_STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ClearColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify clear values for the color buffers

param.name: red
param.para: Specify the red, green, blue, and alpha values used when the color buffers are cleared. The initial values are all 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ClearDepth(System.Single)
member.summary: Specify the clear value for the depth buffer

param.name: depth
param.para: Specifies the depth value used when the depth buffer is cleared. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ClearStencil(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the clear value for the stencil buffer

param.name: s
param.para: Specifies the index used when the stencil buffer is cleared. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ColorMask(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable and disable writing of frame buffer color components

param.name: red
param.para: Specify whether red, green, blue, and alpha can or cannot be written into the frame buffer. The initial values are all GL_TRUE, indicating that the color components can be written.

param.name: shader
param.para: Specifies the shader object to be compiled.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.CompressedTexImage2D(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a two-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 2D texture images that are at least 64 texels wide and cube-mapped texture images that are at least 16 texels wide.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image including the border if any. If the GL version does not support non-power-of-two sizes, this value must be Must be 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . All implementations support 2D texture images that are at least 64 texels high and cube-mapped texture images that are at least 16 texels high.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.CompressedTexImage2D``1(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,``0[])

member.summary: Copy pixels into a 2D texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z.

param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the internal format of the texture. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_RGB, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the lower left corner of the rectangular region of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer .

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup m + 2 ( border ) for some integer .

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.CopyTexSubImage2D(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy a two-dimensional texture subimage

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: xoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the x direction within the texture array.

param.name: yoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the y direction within the texture array.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the lower left corner of the rectangular region of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture subimage.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture subimage.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.DepthFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.DepthFunction)
member.summary: Specify the value used for depth buffer comparisons

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the depth comparison function. Symbolic constants GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_EQUAL, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_NOTEQUAL, GL_GEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS are accepted. The initial value is GL_LESS.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.DepthMask(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable writing into the depth buffer

param.name: flag
param.para: Specifies whether the depth buffer is enabled for writing. If flag is GL_FALSE, depth buffer writing is disabled. Otherwise, it is enabled. Initially, depth buffer writing is enabled.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.DepthRange(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Specify mapping of depth values from normalized device coordinates to window coordinates

param.name: nearVal
param.para: Specifies the mapping of the near clipping plane to window coordinates. The initial value is 0.

param.name: farVal
param.para: Specifies the mapping of the far clipping plane to window coordinates. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.DrawArrays(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BeginMode,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: first
param.para: Specifies the starting index in the enabled arrays.

param.name: count
param.para: Specifies the number of indices to be rendered.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.DrawElements(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BeginMode,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.DrawElementsType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Render primitives from array data

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies what kind of primitives to render. Symbolic constants GL_POINTS, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_LINES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_QUAD_STRIP, GL_QUADS, and GL_POLYGON are accepted.

param.name: count
param.para: Specifies the number of elements to be rendered.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the type of the values in indices. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT.

param.name: indices
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the location where the indices are stored.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetActiveAttrib(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[],OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.ActiveAttribType[],System.Text.StringBuilder)

param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the attribute variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the attribute variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the attribute variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the attribute variable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetActiveUniform(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.ActiveUniformType@,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns information about an active uniform variable for the specified program object

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the uniform variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the uniform variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the uniform variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the uniform variable.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetBufferParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.BufferParameterName,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Return parameters of a buffer object

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, or GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER.

param.name: value
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a buffer object parameter. Accepted values are GL_BUFFER_ACCESS, GL_BUFFER_MAPPED, GL_BUFFER_SIZE, or GL_BUFFER_USAGE.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the requested parameter.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the size of the character buffer for storing the returned source code string.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the length of the string returned in source (excluding the null terminator).

param.name: source
param.para: Specifies an array of characters that is used to return the source code string.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetString(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StringName)
member.summary: Return a string describing the current GL connection

param.name: name
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant, one of GL_VENDOR, GL_RENDERER, GL_VERSION, GL_SHADING_LANGUAGE_VERSION, or GL_EXTENSIONS.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetTexParameter(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GetTextureParameter,System.Single[])
member.summary: Return texture parameter values

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the target texture. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP are accepted.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a texture parameter. GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_TEXTURE_BORDER_COLOR, GL_TEXTURE_PRIORITY, GL_TEXTURE_RESIDENT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC, GL_DEPTH_TEXTURE_MODE, and GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP are accepted.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the texture parameters.

param.para: Returns the texture parameters.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.GetVertexAttrib(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.VertexAttribParameter,System.Single[])

param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the vertex attribute parameter to be queried. Accepted values are GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE, GL_VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED, or GL_CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the generic vertex attribute parameter to be returned.

param.name: pname

param.name: pointer
param.para: Returns the pointer value.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.Hint(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.HintTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.HintMode)
member.summary: Specify implementation-specific hints

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the behavior to be controlled. GL_FOG_HINT, GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT, GL_LINE_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL_POINT_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_POLYGON_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSION_HINT, and GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_HINT are accepted.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the desired behavior. GL_FASTEST, GL_NICEST, and GL_DONT_CARE are accepted.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.PixelStore(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelStoreParameter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set pixel storage modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the parameter to be set. Six values affect the packing of pixel data into memory: GL_PACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_PACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_PACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_PACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_PACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_PACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_PACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT. Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.PolygonOffset(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the scale and units used to calculate depth values

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a scale factor that is used to create a variable depth offset for each polygon. The initial value is 0.

param.name: units
param.para: Is multiplied by an implementation-specific value to create a constant depth offset. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.ReadPixels(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Read a block of pixels from the frame buffer

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle. width and height of one correspond to a single pixel.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.SampleCoverage(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify multisample coverage parameters

param.name: value
param.para: Specify a single floating-point sample coverage value. The value is clamped to the range [0 ,1]. The initial value is 1.0.

param.name: invert
param.para: Specify a single boolean value representing if the coverage masks should be inverted. GL_TRUE and GL_FALSE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.Scissor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Define the scissor box

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the lower left corner of the scissor box. Initially (0, 0).

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the width and height of the scissor box. When a GL context is first attached to a window, width and height are set to the dimensions of that window.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.CullFaceMode,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilFuncSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.CullFaceMode,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilFunction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilMask(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilMaskSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.CullFaceMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Control the front and/or back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether the front and/or back stencil writemask is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilMaskSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.CullFaceMode,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Control the front and/or back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether the front and/or back stencil writemask is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilOp(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp)
member.summary: Set front and back stencil test actions

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.StencilOpSeparate(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.CullFaceMode,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.StencilOp)
member.summary: Set front and/or back stencil test actions

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.GL.TexImage2D(OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.TextureTarget,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelFormat,OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.PixelType,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specify a two-dimensional texture image

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: level
