param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the internal format of the texture. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_COMPRESSED_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE, GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_COMPRESSED_INTENSITY, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_RGB, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SLUMINANCE, GL_SLUMINANCE8, GL_SLUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_SLUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the lower left corner of the rectangular region of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer .

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup m + 2 ( border ) for some integer .

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.CopyTexSubImage2D(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy a two-dimensional texture subimage

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: xoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the x direction within the texture array.

param.name: yoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the y direction within the texture array.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the lower left corner of the rectangular region of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture subimage.

param.name: height
param.para: Specifies the height of the texture subimage.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a single-valued light source parameter for light. GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

member.summary: Define an array of normals

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive normals. If stride is 0, the normals are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first normal in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.Ortho(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Multiply the current matrix with an orthographic matrix

param.name: left
param.para: Specify the coordinates for the left and right vertical clipping planes.

param.name: bottom
param.para: Specify the coordinates for the bottom and top horizontal clipping planes.

param.name: nearVal
param.para: Specify the distances to the nearer and farther depth clipping planes. These values are negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.PixelStore(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set pixel storage modes

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the parameter to be set. Six values affect the packing of pixel data into memory: GL_PACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_PACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_PACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_PACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_PACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_PACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_PACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT. Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.PointSize(System.Single)
member.summary: Specify the diameter of rasterized points

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the diameter of rasterized points. The initial value is 1.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.PolygonOffset(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the scale and units used to calculate depth values

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a scale factor that is used to create a variable depth offset for each polygon. The initial value is 0.

param.name: units
param.para: Is multiplied by an implementation-specific value to create a constant depth offset. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.PushMatrix
member.summary: Push and pop the current matrix stack

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.ReadPixels``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,``0@)
member.summary: Read a block of pixels from the frame buffer

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle. width and height of one correspond to a single pixel.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, or GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Returns the pixel data.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.ReadPixels``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,``0[0:,0:,0:])

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.Rotate(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Multiply the current matrix by a rotation matrix

param.name: angle
param.para: Specifies the angle of rotation, in degrees.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the x, y, and z coordinates of a vector, respectively.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.SampleCoverage(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify multisample coverage parameters

param.name: value
param.para: Specify a single floating-point sample coverage value. The value is clamped to the range [0 ,1]. The initial value is 1.0.

param.name: invert
param.para: Specify a single boolean value representing if the coverage masks should be inverted. GL_TRUE and GL_FALSE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.Scale(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Multiply the current matrix by a general scaling matrix

param.name: x
param.para: Specify scale factors along the x, y, and z axes, respectively.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.Scissor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Define the scissor box

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the lower left corner of the scissor box. Initially (0, 0).

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the width and height of the scissor box. When a GL context is first attached to a window, width and height are set to the dimensions of that window.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.ShadeModel(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All)
member.summary: Select flat or smooth shading

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic value representing a shading technique. Accepted values are GL_FLAT and GL_SMOOTH. The initial value is GL_SMOOTH.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.StencilFunc(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.StencilMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.StencilMask(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Control the front and back writing of individual bits in the stencil planes

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a bit mask to enable and disable writing of individual bits in the stencil planes. Initially, the mask is all 1's.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.StencilOp(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All)
member.summary: Set front and back stencil test actions

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.TexCoordPointer``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32,``0@)
member.summary: Define an array of texture coordinates

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per array element. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each texture coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive texture coordinate sets. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first texture coordinate set in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.TexEnv(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Single)
member.summary: Set texture environment parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture environment parameter. May be either GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single symbolic constant, one of GL_ADD, GL_ADD_SIGNED, GL_INTERPOLATE, GL_MODULATE, GL_DECAL, GL_BLEND, GL_REPLACE, GL_SUBTRACT, GL_COMBINE, GL_TEXTURE, GL_CONSTANT, GL_PRIMARY_COLOR, GL_PREVIOUS, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, a single boolean value for the point sprite texture coordinate replacement, a single floating-point value for the texture level-of-detail bias, or 1.0, 2.0, or 4.0 when specifying the GL_RGB_SCALE or GL_ALPHA_SCALE.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.TexEnv(OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Single*)
member.summary: Set texture environment parameters

param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

May be either GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single symbolic constant, one of GL_ADD, GL_ADD_SIGNED, GL_INTERPOLATE, GL_MODULATE, GL_DECAL, GL_BLEND, GL_REPLACE, GL_SUBTRACT, GL_COMBINE, GL_TEXTURE, GL_CONSTANT, GL_PRIMARY_COLOR, GL_PREVIOUS, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, a single boolean value for the point sprite texture coordinate replacement, a single floating-point value for the texture level-of-detail bias, or 1.0, 2.0, or 4.0 when specifying the GL_RGB_SCALE or GL_ALPHA_SCALE.

param.name: target

member.summary: Set texture parameters

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture, which must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture parameter. pname can be one of the following: GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R, GL_TEXTURE_PRIORITY, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC, GL_DEPTH_TEXTURE_MODE, or GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value of pname.

param.name: xoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the x direction within the texture array.

param.name: yoffset
param.para: Specifies a texel offset in the y direction within the texture array.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture subimage.

param.name: height

param.name: format

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.GL.VertexPointer``1(System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.ES10.All,System.Int32,``0@)
member.summary: Define an array of vertex data

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per vertex. Must be 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive vertices. If stride is 0, the vertices are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first vertex in the array. The initial value is 0.

member.name: T:OpenTK.DisplayDevice
member.summary: Defines a display device on the underlying system, and provides methods to query and change its display parameters.

member.name: M:OpenTK.DisplayDevice.SelectResolution(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Selects an available resolution that matches the specified parameters.
member.param: The width of the requested resolution in pixels.
The height of the requested resolution in pixels.
The bits per pixel of the requested resolution.
The refresh rate of the requested resolution in hertz.
member.returns: The requested DisplayResolution or null if the parameters cannot be met.

remarks.para: If a matching resolution is not found, this function will retry ignoring the specified refresh rate, bits per pixel and resolution, in this order. If a matching resolution still doesn't exist, this function will return the current resolution.
A parameter set to 0 or negative numbers will not be used in the search (e.g. if refreshRate is 0, any refresh rate will be considered valid).
This function allocates memory.

member.name: M:OpenTK.DisplayDevice.ChangeResolution(OpenTK.DisplayResolution)
member.summary: Changes the resolution of the DisplayDevice.
member.exception: Thrown if the requested resolution could not be set.
member.remarks: If the specified resolution is null, this function will restore the original DisplayResolution.

member.name: M:OpenTK.DisplayDevice.ChangeResolution(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Changes the resolution of the DisplayDevice.
member.param: The new width of the DisplayDevice.
The new height of the DisplayDevice.
The new bits per pixel of the DisplayDevice.
The new refresh rate of the DisplayDevice.
member.exception: Thrown if the requested resolution could not be set.

member.name: M:OpenTK.DisplayDevice.RestoreResolution
member.summary: Restores the original resolution of the DisplayDevice.
member.exception: Thrown if the original resolution could not be restored.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALCapability
member.summary: A list of valid Enable/Disable/IsEnabled parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALCapability.Invalid
member.summary: Currently no state toggles exist for vanilla OpenAL and no Extension uses it.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Listener/GetListener parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (Volume amplification) applied. Type: float Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is interpreted as zero volume and the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerf.EfxMetersPerUnit
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This setting is critical if Air Absorption effects are enabled because the amount of Air Absorption applied is directly related to the real-world distance between the Source and the Listener. centimeters 0.01f meters 1.0f kilometers 1000.0f Range [float.MinValue .. float.MaxValue] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Listener/GetListener parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListener3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerfv
member.summary: A list of valid float[] Listener/GetListener parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALListenerfv.Orientation
member.summary: Indicate Listener orientation. Expects two Vector3, At followed by Up.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Source/GetSource parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance
member.summary: Source specific reference distance. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity] At 0.0f, no distance attenuation occurs. Type: float Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MaxDistance
member.summary: Indicate distance above which Sources are not attenuated using the inverse clamped distance model. Default: float.PositiveInfinity Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Source specific rolloff factor. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.Pitch
member.summary: Specify the pitch to be applied, either at Source, or on mixer results, at Listener. Range: [0.5f - 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (volume amplification) applied. Type: float. Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is meaningless with respect to a logarithmic scale; it is interpreted as zero volume - the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MinGain
member.summary: Indicate minimum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.MaxGain
member.summary: Indicate maximum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeInnerAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, inner cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeOuterAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.ConeOuterGain
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone gain. Default: 0.0f Range: [0.0f - 1.0] (Logarithmic)

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.SecOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxAirAbsorptionFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is a multiplier on the amount of Air Absorption applied to the Source. The AL_AIR_ABSORPTION_FACTOR is multiplied by an internal Air Absorption Gain HF value of 0.994 (-0.05dB) per meter which represents normal atmospheric humidity and temperature. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is defined the same way as the Reverb Room Rolloff property: it is one of two methods available in the Effect Extension to attenuate the reflected sound (early reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcef.EfxConeOuterGainHighFrequency
member.summary: (EFX Extension) A directed Source points in a specified direction. The Source sounds at full volume when the listener is directly in front of the source; it is attenuated as the listener circles the Source away from the front. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Source/GetSource parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3f.Direction
member.summary: Specify the current direction vector.

member.summary: A list of valid 8-bit boolean Source/GetSource parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.SourceRelative
member.summary: Indicate that the Source has relative coordinates. Type: bool Range: [True, False]

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.Looping
member.summary: Indicate whether the Source is looping. Type: bool Range: [True, False] Default: False.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxDirectFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, this Source’s direct-path is automatically filtered according to the orientation of the source relative to the listener and the setting of the Source property Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound is automatically attenuated according to source-listener distance and source directivity (as determined by the cone parameters). If it is False, the reflected sound is not attenuated according to distance and directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is AL_TRUE (its default value), the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound at high frequencies will be automatically attenuated according to the high-frequency source directivity as set by the Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF property. If this property is AL_FALSE, the Source’s reflected sound is not filtered at all according to the Source’s directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSourcei.EfxDirectFilter
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This Source property is used to apply filtering on the direct-path (dry signal) of a Source.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3i
member.summary: A list of valid 3x Int32 Source/GetSource parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.ALSource3i.EfxAuxiliarySendFilter
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This Source property is used to establish connections between Sources and Auxiliary Effect Slots. For a Source to feed an Effect that has been loaded into an Auxiliary Effect Slot the application must configure one of the Source’s auxiliary sends. This process involves setting 3 variables – the destination Auxiliary Effect Slot ID, the Auxiliary Send number, and an optional Filter ID. Type: uint Range: any valid Filter Handle.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Half
member.summary: The name Half is derived from half-precision floating-point number. It occupies only 16 bits, which are split into 1 Sign bit, 5 Exponent bits and 10 Mantissa bits.
member.remarks: Quote from ARB_half_float_pixel specification: Any representable 16-bit floating-point value is legal as input to a GL command that accepts 16-bit floating-point data. The result of providing a value that is not a floating-point number (such as infinity or NaN) to such a command is unspecified, but must not lead to GL interruption or termination. Providing a denormalized number or negative zero to GL must yield predictable results.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Half.Equals(OpenTK.Half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified OpenTK.Half value.
member.param: OpenTK.Half object to compare to this instance..
member.returns: True, if other is equal to this instance; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Half.CompareTo(OpenTK.Half)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified half-precision floating-point number and returns an integer that indicates whether the value of this instance is less than, equal to, or greater than the value of the specified half-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A half-precision floating-point number to compare.
member.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. If the number is:
Less than zero, then this instance is less than other, or this instance is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN) and other is a number.
Zero: this instance is equal to value, or both this instance and other are not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN), OpenTK.Half.PositiveInfinity, or OpenTK.Half.NegativeInfinity.
Greater than zero: this instance is greater than othrs, or this instance is a number and other is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN).

member.summary: Provides access to GamePad devices. Note: this API is not implemented yet.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Platform.MacOS.Agl.aglChoosePixelFormat(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Use this overload only with IntPtr.Zero for the first argument.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Effect/GetEffect parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Lowering the value adds more coloration to the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. The default 1.0f provides the highest density. Reducing diffusion gives the reverberation a more "grainy" character that is especially noticeable with percussive sound sources. If you set a diffusion value of 0.0f, the later reverberation sounds like a succession of distinct echoes. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbGain
member.summary: The Reverb Gain property is the master volume control for the reflected sound - both early reflections and reverberation - that the reverb effect adds to all sound sources. Ranges from 1.0 (0db) (the maximum amount) to 0.0 (-100db) (no reflected sound at all) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbGainHF
member.summary: The Reverb Gain HF property further tweaks reflected sound by attenuating it at high frequencies. It controls a low-pass filter that applies globally to the reflected sound of all sound sources feeding the particular instance of the reverb effect. Ranges from 1.0f (0db) (no filter) to 0.0f (-100db) (virtually no reflected sound) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0 (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: The Decay HF Ratio property sets the spectral quality of the Decay Time parameter. It is the ratio of high-frequency decay time relative to the time set by Decay Time.. Unit: linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: The Reflections Gain property controls the overall amount of initial reflections relative to the Gain property. The value of Reflections Gain ranges from a maximum of 3.16f (+10 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no initial reflections at all), and is corrected by the value of the Gain property. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: The Reflections Delay property is the amount of delay between the arrival time of the direct path from the source to the first reflection from the source. It ranges from 0 to 300 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. The value of Late Reverb Gain ranges from a maximum of 10.0f (+20 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no late reverberation at all). Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium and applies to reflected sound only. Unit: Linear gain per meter Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL's Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ChorusRate
member.summary: This property sets the modulation rate of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ChorusDepth
member.summary: This property controls the amount by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ChorusFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of processed signal that is fed back to the input of the chorus effect. Negative values will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. At full magnitude the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: +0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.ChorusDelay
member.summary: This property controls the average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back, and with feedback, the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Larger values lower the pitch. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.016f] Default: 0.016f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.DistortionEdge
member.summary: This property controls the shape of the distortion. The higher the value for Edge, the "dirtier" and "fuzzier" the effect. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.2f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.DistortionGain
member.summary: This property allows you to attenuate the distorted sound. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.DistortionLowpassCutoff
member.summary: Input signals can have a low pass filter applied, to limit the amount of high frequency signal feeding into the distortion effect. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 8000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.DistortionEQCenter
member.summary: This property controls the frequency at which the post-distortion attenuation (Distortion Gain) is active. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.DistortionEQBandwidth
member.summary: This property controls the bandwidth of the post-distortion attenuation. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EchoDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the original sound and the first "tap", or echo instance. Subsequently, the value for Echo Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "second tap" and the next "first tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.207f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EchoLRDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the "first tap" and the "second tap". Subsequently, the value for Echo LR Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "first tap" and the next "second tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.404f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EchoDamping
member.summary: This property controls the amount of high frequency damping applied to each echo. As the sound is subsequently fed back for further echoes, damping results in an echo which progressively gets softer in tone as well as intensity. Range [0.0f .. 0.99f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EchoFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of feedback the output signal fed back into the input. Use this parameter to create "cascading" echoes. At full magnitude, the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Below full magnitude, the sample will repeat and fade. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EchoSpread
member.summary: This property controls how hard panned the individual echoes are. With a value of 1.0f, the first "tap" will be panned hard left, and the second "tap" hard right. –1.0f gives the opposite result and values near to 0.0f result in less emphasized panning. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.FlangerRate
member.summary: The number of times per second the low-frequency oscillator controlling the amount of delay repeats. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.27f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.FlangerDepth
member.summary: The ratio by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.FlangerFeedback
member.summary: This is the amount of the output signal level fed back into the effect's input. A negative value will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -0.5f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.FlangerDelay
member.summary: The average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back. When used with the Feedback property it's the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.004f] Default: 0.002f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.FrequencyShifterFrequency
member.summary: This is the carrier frequency. For carrier frequencies below the audible range, the single sideband modulator may produce phaser effects, spatial effects or a slight pitch-shift. As the carrier frequency increases, the timbre of the sound is affected. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.VocalMorpherRate
member.summary: This controls the frequency of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.41f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.RingModulatorFrequency
member.summary: This is the frequency of the carrier signal. If the carrier signal is slowly varying (less than 20 Hz), the result is a slow amplitude variation effect (tremolo). Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 440.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.RingModulatorHighpassCutoff
member.summary: This controls the cutoff frequency at which the input signal is high-pass filtered before being ring modulated. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 800.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.AutowahAttackTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from minimum to maximum center frequency when it is triggered by input signal. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.AutowahReleaseTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from maximum back to base center frequency, when the input signal ends. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.AutowahResonance
member.summary: This property controls the resonant peak, sometimes known as emphasis or Q, of the auto-wah band-pass filter. Range [2.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 1000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.AutowahPeakGain
member.summary: This property controls the input signal level at which the band-pass filter will be fully opened. Range [0.00003f .. 31621.0f] Default: 11.22f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerLowGain
member.summary: This property controls amount of cut or boost on the low frequency range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerLowCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the low frequency below which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [50.0f .. 800.0f] Default: 200.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid1Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid1" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid1Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid1" range. Unit: Hz Range [200.0f .. 3000.0f] Default: 500.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid1Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid1" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid2Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid2" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid2Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid2" range. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 3000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerMid2Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid2" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerHighGain
member.summary: This property allows to cut/boost the signal at high frequencies. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EqualizerHighCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the high frequency above which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [4000.0f .. 16000.0f] Default: 6000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbGain
member.summary: Reverb Gain controls the level of the reverberant sound in an environment. A high level of reverb is characteristic of rooms with highly reflective walls and/or small dimensions. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbGainHF
member.summary: Gain HF is used to attenuate the high frequency content of all the reflected sound in an environment. You can use this property to give a room specific spectral characteristic. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbGainLF
member.summary: Gain LF is the low frequency counterpart to Gain HF. Use this to reduce or boost the low frequency content in an environment. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0f (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: Decay HF Ratio scales the decay time of high frequencies relative to the value of the Decay Time property. By changing this value, you are changing the amount of time it takes for the high frequencies to decay compared to the mid frequencies of the reverb. Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbDecayLFRatio
member.summary: Decay LF Ratio scales the decay time of low frequencies in the reverberation in the same manner that Decay HF Ratio handles high frequencies. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: Reflections Gain sets the level of the early reflections in an environment. Early reflections are used as a cue for determining the size of the environment we are in. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: Reflections Delay controls the amount of time it takes for the first reflected wave front to reach the listener, relative to the arrival of the direct-path sound. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbEchoTime
member.summary: Echo Time controls the rate at which the cyclic echo repeats itself along the reverberation decay. Range [0.075f .. 0.25f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbEchoDepth
member.summary: Echo Depth introduces a cyclic echo in the reverberation decay, which will be noticeable with transient or percussive sounds. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbModulationTime
member.summary: Modulation Time controls the speed of the rate of periodic changes in pitch (vibrato). Range [0.04f .. 4.0f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbModulationDepth
member.summary: Modulation Depth controls the amount of pitch change. Low values of Diffusion will contribute to reinforcing the perceived effect by reducing the mixing of overlapping reflections in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium. It applies to reflected sound only. Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbHFReference
member.summary: The property HF reference determines the frequency at which the high-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 20000.0f] Default: 5000.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbLFReference
member.summary: The property LF reference determines the frequency at which the low-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [20.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 250.0f

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectf.EaxReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffect3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Effect/GetEffect parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffect3f.EaxReverbLateReverbPan
member.summary: Reverb Pan does for the Reverb what Reflections Pan does for the Reflections. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffect3f.EaxReverbReflectionsPan
member.summary: This Vector3 controls the spatial distribution of the cluster of early reflections. The direction of this vector controls the global direction of the reflections, while its magnitude controls how focused the reflections are towards this direction. For legacy reasons this Vector3 follows a left-handed co-ordinate system! Note that OpenAL uses a right-handed coordinate system. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 Effect/GetEffect parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.ChorusWaveform
member.summary: This property sets the waveform shape of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.ChorusPhase
member.summary: This property controls the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillators. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Unit: Degrees Range [-180 .. 180] Default: 90

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.FlangerWaveform
member.summary: Selects the shape of the low-frequency oscillator waveform that controls the amount of the delay of the sampled signal. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.FlangerPhase
member.summary: This changes the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillator's. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Range [-180 .. +180] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.FrequencyShifterLeftDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.FrequencyShifterRightDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.VocalMorpherPhonemeA
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter A, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 0, "Phoneme A"

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.VocalMorpherPhonemeACoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter A in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.VocalMorpherPhonemeB
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter B, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 10, "Phoneme ER"

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.VocalMorpherPhonemeBCoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter B in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.VocalMorpherWaveform
member.summary: This controls the shape of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle, (2) Sawtooth Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.PitchShifterCoarseTune
member.summary: This sets the number of semitones by which the pitch is shifted. There are 12 semitones per octave. Unit: Semitones Range [-12 .. +12] Default: +12

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.PitchShifterFineTune
member.summary: This sets the number of cents between Semitones a pitch is shifted. A Cent is 1/100th of a Semitone. Unit: Cents Range [-50 .. +50] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.RingModulatorWaveform
member.summary: This controls which waveform is used as the carrier signal. Traditional ring modulator and tremolo effects generally use a sinusoidal carrier. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Sawtooth, (2) Square Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.CompressorOnoff
member.summary: Enabling this will result in audio exhibiting smaller variation in intensity between the loudest and quietest portions. Unit: (0) Off, (1) On Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffecti.ReverbDecayHFLimit
member.summary: When this flag is set, the high-frequency decay time automatically stays below a limit value that's derived from the setting of the property Air Absorption HF. Unit: (0) False, (1) True Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType
member.summary: Effect type definitions to be used with EfxEffecti.EffectType.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Null
member.summary: No Effect, disable. This Effect type is used when an Effect object is initially created.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Reverb
member.summary: The Reverb effect is the standard Effects Extension's environmental reverberation effect. It is available on all Generic Software and Generic Hardware devices.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Chorus
member.summary: The Chorus effect essentially replays the input audio accompanied by another slightly delayed version of the signal, creating a "doubling" effect.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Distortion
member.summary: The Distortion effect simulates turning up (overdriving) the gain stage on a guitar amplifier or adding a distortion pedal to an instrument's output.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Echo
member.summary: The Echo effect generates discrete, delayed instances of the input signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Flanger
member.summary: The Flanger effect creates a "tearing" or "whooshing" sound, like a jet flying overhead.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.FrequencyShifter
member.summary: The Frequency shifter is a single-sideband modulator, which translates all the component frequencies of the input signal by an equal amount.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.VocalMorpher
member.summary: The Vocal morpher consists of a pair of 4-band formant filters, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.PitchShifter
member.summary: The Pitch shifter applies time-invariant pitch shifting to the input signal, over a one octave range and controllable at a semi-tone and cent resolution.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.RingModulator
member.summary: The Ring modulator multiplies an input signal by a carrier signal in the time domain, resulting in tremolo or inharmonic effects.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Autowah
member.summary: The Auto-wah effect emulates the sound of a wah-wah pedal used with an electric guitar, or a mute on a brass instrument.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Compressor
member.summary: The Compressor will boost quieter portions of the audio, while louder portions will stay the same or may even be reduced.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.Equalizer
member.summary: The Equalizer is very flexible, providing tonal control over four different adjustable frequency ranges.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxEffectType.EaxReverb
member.summary: The EAX Reverb has a more advanced parameter set than EfxEffectType.Reverb, but is only natively supported on devices that support the EAX 3.0 or above.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxAuxiliaryi
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 AuxiliaryEffectSlot/GetAuxiliaryEffectSlot parameters

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxAuxiliaryi.EffectslotEffect
member.summary: This property is used to attach an Effect object to the Auxiliary Effect Slot object. After the attachment, the Auxiliary Effect Slot object will contain the effect type and have the same effect parameters that were stored in the Effect object. Any Sources feeding the Auxiliary Effect Slot will immediate feed the new effect type and new effect parameters.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.EfxAuxiliaryi.EffectslotAuxiliarySendAuto
member.summary: This property is used to enable or disable automatic send adjustments based on the physical positions of the sources and the listener. This property should be enabled when an application wishes to use a reverb effect to simulate the environment surrounding a listener or a collection of Sources. Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: P:OpenTK.Input.KeyboardDevice.KeyRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean indicating key repeat status.
member.remarks:
If KeyRepeat is true, multiple KeyDown events will be generated while a key is being held. Otherwise only one KeyDown event will be reported.
The rate of the generated KeyDown events is controlled by the Operating System. Usually, one KeyDown event will be reported, followed by a small (250-1000ms) pause and several more KeyDown events (6-30 events per second).
Set to true to handle text input (where keyboard repeat is desirable), but set to false for game input.
